website_summaries.verdict: A pair of slippers that offers an extra degree of comfort and foot support.
pros: Extra padding provides a higher degree of cushion and support
Memory foam will mold the footbed over time to provide an ergonomic surface
Soft microterry offers a luxurious spa feel
cons: Shoes can have a plastic or chemical smell upon first use

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I've owned these slippers for 6 days and have only worn them inside the house. This evening I was walking to my kitchen and suddenly did a face plant onto the tile floor. Why did I suddenly trip and fall? The sole of the slipper had separated from the upper and was flapping. Isotoner should be very ashamed. I'm in my 70s and I'm darn lucky I wasn't seriously injured.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: These are great year round for me because I don't mind wearing ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great year round for me because I don't mind wearing socks in the winter with them. What really makes them better than others is the support in the footbed. I have tried a variety and spent more money than I should on slippers but I love to have them because of my hardwood floors. I don't walk around my house in my everyday shoes. So I wear mine probably more than most people do. The top of the slipper is soft and completely adjustable. Great slipper!
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Slippers
customer_reviews.text: I have to wear either open toe shoes or deep toe box shoes because of having a crushed foot in an auto accident. These slippers are the only ones I can find with enough support. This is the 2nd pair I have owned and will continue to purchase them when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda P. Golden

customer_reviews.title: Like walking on pillows!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh I love these slippers! I am so happy I bought them! I am pregnant and was looking for something comfy to wear to walk around my hardwood floors and these are perfect! like walking on super soft pillows. I've had them for over two weeks now and they have not lost any thickness, they still feel like new and I wear them practically all day. I would wear them out to the store if I could!
customer_reviews.author: Alie K

customer_reviews.title: Sole material smells strong like a chemical plant blew up. Quality has gone to the dogs.
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased these comfortable slippers to help alleviate the harshness of walking on laminate floors. We bought them in 1/27/15, 5/16/15, 9/9/15, 2/16/16, 4/14/16 and just now on 8/1/16. They last about 3 months with everyday use. This is okay with us. The most recent pair have the most obnoxious odor from the sole that we have ever smelled. We washed them, soaked them, washed with scent beads etc - but they still stink. Clearly, the company ISOTONER has gone to a different china manufacturer with no standards or quality control. Stay away - you will end up with some sort of disease from this smell (or at least get sick to your stomach).
customer_reviews.author: Busy Dad

customer_reviews.title: Velcro does not adjust far enough for a good fit
customer_reviews.text: The foam footbeds of these slippers are very comfortable. However, they have created a design flaw. After a few minutes, your foot will sink into the foam footbed. But, the adjustable strap does not take this into consideration. The velcro does not extend far enough to make the slipper fit properly. As a result, my foot slips through to the front as I am walking, and my toes hang over the edge. This is not comfortable. If the adjustable strap could make the fit more snug, it could be a great slipper. Also, I do NOT have narrow feet. I take a wide width in shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Francie

customer_reviews.title: This Design Doesn't Work For Me
customer_reviews.text: These slippers seem to be made well with good materials, but they don't work for me. I don't know what it is about these slippers, but there's not enough support with this to hold your feet in place. My feet kept sliding to one side or the other so much that I actually get foot cramps while wearing this. It doesn't matter how much I tighten them. There's not enough support and that's dangerous because I almost fell a couple of times because my feet were moving around too much. Since then, I have washed them and gave them away as donation. They wash very well as advertised, but that's the only good thing about them.
customer_reviews.author: maven

customer_reviews.title: Too Wide, Velcro Doesn't Last, Threw Away
customer_reviews.text: These are made with a very soft terry cloth and a deeply cushioned sole. You can change the fit because there is velcro holding the top over onto the side. The deeply cushioned sole molds to your foot and thus it provides support. The down side is it's sized wide and even with the velcro I couldn't get them to the tightness needed for a house slipper. My foot is a medium width and not narrow so these are really wide. After moving the strap over using the velcro for a about 3 months, it stopped sticking and would come undone easily and be a tripping hazard. I threw them away after 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Denise F.

customer_reviews.title: You feel like you are walking on cushions
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth pair of these slippers. I buy a new pair every year. I wear them out because they are the only ones I wear around my house. When I come home from work or just running out and about, the first thing I do when I get home is take off my shoes and put on my slippers. I have also given them as gifts throughout the years and they have been well received. In fact those slippers are been bought again by those recipients themselves or I have been asked to get them again for a Christmas gift . You feel like you are walking on cushions. I would highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: PJT

customer_reviews.title: Great, But Not For Elderly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these lovely slippers for my Mother. Mom is 87, petite, 105 pounds. They fit true to size, however the weight and the heel of the slippers give my Mom of 87 a balance problem. They're heavy for Mom to use. The Heel is a tad too high for Mom to Feel comfortable walking about at home in them. I would recommend these for anyone looking for a luxury feel, adjustable strap, soft slipper. Not For An Elderly Person, who at this age usually Have Trouble With Balance. Heel Is Too High and Weight is Too Heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Cali

customer_reviews.title: The slipper you’ve been searching for especially if you have thin feet!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair of these slippers. They’re wonderfully comfortable and more firm and supportive than most slippers and maintain their support for a long time. My feet are very thin, arthritic and flat so the fact that they’re adjustable is what also sets them apart from other slippers. They wash well and have never fallen apart with use. Great product that can be hard to find so I always keep a new pair waiting in the closet!
customer_reviews.author: Crozetian

customer_reviews.title: Definitely "spa" worthy!
customer_reviews.text: Having given away a brand new pair of Isotoner slippers a few years ago because they were too small, I was afraid these might be too small as well and went up a half size rather than down. These are adjustable so I can make them as tight or loose as I want. The footbed itself is too long, but I'm not using the slippers for long distance treks around the house or even up and down a staircase so any potential tripping hazard isn't of concern. And, oh are they comfortable!!! Truly worthy of the term "spa."
customer_reviews.author: 4-Chin Fancier

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but annoying.
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable but rather wide, and there is no real adjustment to make the slipper narrower. Also, the part where the the straps meet creates a prominent, uneven sort of bump underneath against the skin of the upper foot which becomes very abrasive and annoying when worn for more than a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Doc

customer_reviews.title: Go one size up
customer_reviews.text: While these are adjustable in width, you won’t want the Velcro exposed catching lint and hair. I’ve used other isotoner slippers and wanted even more support. Found I needed a size up on these. You’ll need to give them at least 2 days to create your footprint in them they are that thick. I’m glad I was patient and worked them in. They are very comfortable and of course I love the slide on and off ability. Very supportive for achy feet.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Clevenger

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable slippers
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful house slippers. They are very cushioned. It really is like walking on pillows They are also adjustable so if your feet swell you can loosen them as needed. The have a no slip sole. And you can put them in the washer and dryer. I have been wearing these for years. I would highly recommend these slippers!
customer_reviews.author: Frequent shopper

customer_reviews.title: Love and hate this slipper!
customer_reviews.text: I love the comfort of this slipper. It has a nice thick sole which gives a stable slipper, it is well padded for comfort and is adjustable. What I don't like is I have three pairs of them and on two of them the Velcro is coming undone and won't hold together. It is fixable, but I shouldn't have to do that. I just started to wear the third pair so to early to tell if I will have a problem with it yet or not. Great slipper if not for this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Emmalee701

customer_reviews.title: Tightness can be adjusted
customer_reviews.text: This Pillow step spa slipper is very comfortable and well constructed. Across the top you can adjust the width of the slipper to fit your foot. It is soft and has a nice amount of support. The sole is excellent for indoor and outdoor wear. I recommend this slipper. I have another one that is about eight years old and looks almost as good as when I purchased it. Just wanted another one to have when this one is being washed and dried.
customer_reviews.author: RSM

customer_reviews.title: I loved these comfortable slippers....
customer_reviews.text: ....for $9.60 in January 2020. Not so much for $18.71 in April 2020, when I came back to order a second, back up pair. Imagine my surprise to find that opportunistic pricing applies to slippers! This purchase can wait for our eventual return to normality. (Hopefully, so can we all!) If your purchase can't wait, I highly recommend these slippers for comfort. In the meantime, into the washer they go! Wish me luck.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby's Girl

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: After wearing them for a few weeks, they no longer have the support they did in the beginning. They've molded to my feet, but I'm extremely flat footed so not having the support under my lack of arches is not good. I will admit I wear them lot, every day around the house whenever I'm home bc I don't like to be barefoot. Fit is great though and for the money they're decent.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Seay

customer_reviews.title: FOAM SOLE FAILS QUICKLY
customer_reviews.text: I can't recommend these slippers even though at first they were quite comfortable and I like that the width was adjustable. After a few weeks the foam sole became so compressed that it was very hard and uncomfortable. I'm going to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: Rosieannie0

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow for my not wide feet
customer_reviews.text: These slippers appeared well made and sturdy and probably quite cushiony, however the size I ordered was way too small for me. I usually wear a 7 or 7.5 and more frequently a 7 in open toed shoes and do not have wide feet so I ordered the 6.5-7. The length wasn't as much of an issue as was the width which as way too narrow. I did not order the size up due to the fact I was concerned the width would be an issue even in the larger size. Easy returns with Amazon, tho!
customer_reviews.author: CarolH

customer_reviews.title: Really nice looking and comfortable slipper
customer_reviews.text: I just received these so I haven’t worn them other than to try them on. I bought them for an upcoming extended stay in Florida so I’m saving them until then. They look very nice, have a nice sole and fit great! The top of the slipper is a Velcro closure so they can be adjusted fir your personal width. They seem very durable so I don’t anticipate any issues.
customer_reviews.author: NANCY J

customer_reviews.title: Like walking on nails
customer_reviews.text: The insole is secured to the memory foam with a quilting of large knots in thick, nylon string. The thin microfiber covering the big, lumpy knots does not protect the wearer's feet from feeling them. It feels much like walking with shoes filled with small, sharp rocks. Unless you want to feel like you are doing penance, avoid these uncomfortable slippers!
customer_reviews.author: Moving On

customer_reviews.title: Might be ok if they would stay on!!
customer_reviews.text: The Velcro closure on these slippers aren't very strong and they come undone if you move too quickly or turn your foot the wrong way. First time it happened I almost fell! I started walking differently to try to keep them on and realized it was so stupid to be so uncomfortable in the one pair of shoes that are supposed to be all about comfort. In the bin. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: BarryB1216

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought Acorn brand
customer_reviews.text: I tried the Isotoner brand of the adjustable slide slipper. I should have stuck with a product I knew. These wore unevenly with my foot sliding off of the side becoming uncomfortable and making me unsteady. I expected the cushioning to collapse some which is why I really like the ability to tighten the slipper. I can't adjust it to overcome the uneven wear.
customer_reviews.author: Mel D.

customer_reviews.title: A Great Product from a Reliable Manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I've purchased this slipper, and it won't be the last. I wore the first pair until they were in shreds because they were so comfortable (and washable). The Velcro makes the strap across the foot completely adjustable so the slipper stays on even a narrow foot. A nice range of colors is available so the slippers can be matched to a favorite robe. This manufacturer offers top quality in every product they make.
customer_reviews.author: DROP130

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed, they felt great for about 4 days and ...
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed, they felt great for about 4 days and then they started to flatten out, they are completely flat now, I am on tile all day and wanted some cushion, the way they were described I thought they would be perfect, not.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I order my first pair and they literally lasted less then 2 weeks before the front of the soles detatcged from the slippers. I was sent a replacement AND WITHIN 3 weeks they did the same exact thing. They are comfortable but they don't eve last a month before they start falling apart. I only wore them inside my house with socks on. It's ridiculous. I've spent WAY LESS money on cheap Walmart house slippers that have lasted me over a year. Very disappointed, DO NOT WASTE YOUR $$$$$ I will upload pictures of both pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Ahhhh.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these slippers about a month ago and I like them so much I bought a second pair eventhough I did not need them. I wear narrow shoes and getting slippers in my size at a decent price is difficult. These are adjustable and I am able to get them just right. Also some of the most comfortable slippers I have had in a long time-I wear them all day, even outside (although not on purpose-I just forget I have them on). They are well made and I know they will last a long time. Thankyou, Isotoner.
customer_reviews.author: CalifWoman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I had knee surgery and because it made me walk differently I developed severe pain in the bottom of my foot in that leg. I tried more products than I can count then got a pair of these and after a few days no more pain. Pain left and has never returned. Got a second pair so when wash one pair have my spare pair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon is great!

customer_reviews.title: Worse slippers ever.
customer_reviews.text: The worst slippers I've ever gotten! I wish I hadn't cut off the tags and tossed the packaging. I will never be able to wear them. They would be fine if Ionly stood still. However, I would need to actually walk with them on. This being the problem, they are so very stiff and they slide off with every step. They are the correct size and fit, but, no matter how tight I close the velcro, they fall/slide off my feet. I'm very disappointed in this brand, I've heard they're suppose to be so good. These are a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: why q? as in susie-q & no I don't want to change it. Lots of people just call me q

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I have a narrow foot and the slipper cannot be adjusted to fit. I do not safe in this slipper since my feet slide around and they feel insecure. If you wear a narrow shoe don't buy them, they won't stay on your feet. I would love to return them, can't since I have worn them.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Taub

customer_reviews.title: My mother won’t take them off.
customer_reviews.text: My mom had Avon Spa slippers from 30 years ago.. these were the closest to those, and the loves them. She had her knees replaced and needs slippers with support, and she wears these every day during recovery. On week 3 now and I don’t think she’s going to stop wearing these for another 30 years.
customer_reviews.author: E. P.

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother buying these
customer_reviews.text: As I walked, the Velcro kept loosening until I ended up walking out of these slippers and leaving them behind me on the floor because they wouldn't stay stuck together. Very disappointed. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: worship2AbbaFather

customer_reviews.title: The Flying Nun Comes to Life!
customer_reviews.text: The flap on the slippers is nothing like in the picture. They stick out like airplane wings and I promise you they will constantly hit something as you walk around the house. Other than that, very comfy. Day three: they are already falling apart. A hole has appeared in a location that is not rubbed or being rubbed against my foot or anything else. Very disappointing. Other than that, again, very comfy. Just not what we'd expect from Isotoner. Will never buy again. Take your money elsewhere unless you wish for your feet to look like characters from the Flying Nun.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Simms

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected from Isotoner
customer_reviews.text: I have had Isotoner slippers that were wonderful. After trying these for a bit over a month they are still uncomfortable. I thought perhaps they just needed to be broken in a bit. The problem is you can't break in something that you can't wear for more than a few minutes without your feet, and knees hurting. On the bright side these slippers are adjustable. It should be noted that no matter how you tighten them you will have the delightful sensation that you are wobbling with every step. There are other reviews that warned of this unsteady feeling. Having never had this issue before, I assumed these would be fine. They were not.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL
customer_reviews.text: There needs to be more Velcro on the slipper for flap to attach to, because if you pull all the way across the end sticks out. The sole of these slippers is so stiff and hard, they do not bend at all, I feel like I am walking around in clog hoppers, so STIFF and HARD.....Awful!
customer_reviews.author: Goldens821

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Snug True Form Slippers
customer_reviews.text: Needed a house slipper with support and comfort. Isotoner is a great product. Very comfortable. Hugs feet well. No slippery. Memory foam. Definitely great for everyday personal use or a gift
customer_reviews.author: BuchRanch16

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My mom had surgery several years ago on her foot, and she can't wear most shoes anymore. She has a big, clunky pair of orthopedic shoes that she hates, but they take her forever to put on. She tried these slippers and she loves them. She's been getting a new pair every year so they look new, but she still wears some of the older ones as well. She wears them out of the home, all year round, so they get a lot of abuse, but they are still okay. We also wash them in the machine on the gentle cycle, then air dry them, and they still are okay.
customer_reviews.author: sheepy

customer_reviews.title: Happy Comfy Fit
customer_reviews.text: I've always loved these and will buy again. The fit was just right. As always, these are absolutely comfortable with the arch support I need. Thank you. :) After a second buy, I am still pleased of the comfort and how easy it is to walk in these. Very happy customer. :)
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: OK,  AT FIRST.............
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable at first, but they go flat very quickly even after washing. velcro top does not close enough to fit my size 9/10 normal width foot. ugh. haven't owned them long, but I'm shopping right now for a different pair. So the memory foam bottom is just not supportive at all. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Christie Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Love These
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable slippers I have ever worn. I love them and will be ordering another pair. I have plantar fasciitis and we have solid wood floors which are very hard on my feet. These are sufficiently thick enough to cushion my entire foot. I have also washed them a couple of times with no problems, though I did not put in dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: On 2nd pair, two years later
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brand two years ago. Best pair of slippers I've ever had. Comfortable and wash well. Just ordered another pair. Also, I recently had knee surgery and I have to say these were perfect during recovery. Easy to slip on and comfortable to walk on. Thickness of memory foam was a welcomed cushion to relieve any soreness while doing exercises. Good grip on bottom, too.
customer_reviews.author: Mary P.

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: I just got these, so haven't gotten the full jest of it yet, but they do feel like walking in pillows. I'm kind of having a hard time with the velcro flaps, I wanst sure if I would like that or not, my foot dosent like the "underflap feel" , so that is taking some getting used to. But very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Soft and well cushioned. I wear them all the ...
customer_reviews.text: Soft and well cushioned. I wear them all the time inside as I have tile floors and these really save my feet. The only slight nuisance is sometimes the Velcro pulls loose and the slippers completely open and come off. I have had these slippers before and if I remember correctly this only happens when they are new. Once the footbed settles down and molds to your foot the problem should stop. I will update after I have had these a few more days.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Heavenly Slippers - Nothing Else Comes Close !
customer_reviews.text: Heaven under your feet. I have had many slippers but these are in a class by themselves. Lots of cushioning but you feel sure about your steps, unlike others which can leave you unbalanced. One caution: hold onto the banister coming downstairs bc you want to make sure to plant your foot down with stability. Get them ! A true bargain (I ordered another pair !)
customer_reviews.author: LorraineAbelow

customer_reviews.title: Need a new pair
customer_reviews.text: The left shoe has a sharp point that bothers my foot when I wear them. This is the 3 rd pair I have bought and they have all been great. However, this pair has s not acceptable. What do I need to do to get this pair replaced? I have thrown away the original packaging and even tried to cut the object out. I think if you receive the shoes you will agree that the object is part of the shoe and needs to be removed and possibly patched or just replaced.
customer_reviews.author: RALPH WILSON

customer_reviews.title: Plush, but question safety.
customer_reviews.text: I have a size 9 medium foot. The 8 1/2-9 is a little big. It has a plush, velvety footbed. The downside is that my heel slips out of the slipper if it's not on a flat surface. As another reviewer mentioned, the velcro does not get tight enough. So, okay for around the house, but wouldn't go down stairs or be too active in them for safety purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Ambrosia

customer_reviews.title: I really like the price
customer_reviews.text: I've owned Acorn slippers and decided to purchase the Isotoner Microterry Pillowstep on this go around. When comparing the two, note that the width can be adjusted by Velcro, the soles can be worn indoors and outdoors without worrying about holes forming and they are both machine washable. I really like the price, the grooves on my feet and the softness the Isotoner provides. The Acorns were a little rough (towel roughness) after so many washes. I can not provide any feedback on the Isotoners after they are washed since I've owned them for a few days now. I'm hoping they retain their softness after I wash them.
customer_reviews.author: AV

customer_reviews.title: Not what you would think. Disappointing at best.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. They look comfortable but when put on they have no memory foam worth speaking about. They also are very large and can’t be tightened enough. If you have wide feet you may have success but I personally would risk it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Z

customer_reviews.title: Very narrow
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty sad when my foot did not fit these. I wear a 6 and 6.5 depending on the shoes. I ordered the 6.5/7. I have wider than average feet and assumed since the top was adjustable that they would fit. Not so much. The velcro barely clung on at the very end and if I took one step they popped open. So sad since they seemed like they were ultra cushy.
customer_reviews.author: pickyshopper

customer_reviews.title: So Comfy!!
customer_reviews.text: I was recently pregnant with bad sciatica pain. I needed a good pair of slippers to wear around the house. These are great. While they didn’t relieve all my pain, they did significantly reduce it. I liked that the strap was adjustable as my feet have been swollen and continued to be so post partum. They are soft, cushy, and comfy. They also wash up easily in the laundry. I highly recommend them
customer_reviews.author: grapekate

customer_reviews.title: Too bad. They are pretty
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for me. It's not really that it is too small. It's that the flap across the top cuts to my foot. It doesn't help to loosen it because then my foot just slides forward & it still cuts into it. I need to send them back. Too bad. They are pretty.
customer_reviews.author: button nose

customer_reviews.title: Sizing not accurate
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Size description not accurate. I wear 6.5 - 7. Shoes are much too short. Plus the velcro tops do not stay secure while walking - they start pulling apart. I have narrow feet so I can't imagine anyone with a wide foot even being able to connect the two straps.
customer_reviews.author: Catlady76

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I found these slippers uncomfortable. My foot kept tuning in them which made them (for me) unsafe. They might work better on someone else.
customer_reviews.author: chirp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These slippers were perfect for indoor/outdoor use. I wanted them for after surgery when the cast was off & my foot was /is still swollen. I'm so glad I did, b/c so far, it's the most comfortable one that I switch to most often.
customer_reviews.author: Angels Whisper

customer_reviews.title: Runs small. But totally worth 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear an 8.5. The ones I bought say they are 8.5-9. They fit more like an 8. Not enough of a reason to give them less then 5stars. Most comfortable slipper I’ve worn.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I got these to cushion my feet which were sore from chemo treatment. They are thick but not really squishy and soft. The fabric is soft. Just not quite what I wanted. Feels like the won’t last long either.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because I have just had Achilles heel tendon surgery and cannot get my foot into any other slippers I have. The only thing I can think of to improve them would be a little wider velcro. I would not have been able to get them on a week ago when my foot was still very swollen. Also, some arch support would be nice. They have been wonderful for wearing around the house. I may get another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Eltezam

customer_reviews.title: soft and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are the ugliest slippers I've ever owned but I needed slippers that are open-toe since I have to keep my toes aired out after recovering from an infection. They are comfortable and easy to adjust the velcro. I had to cut the tag out since it was scratching against my foot but otherwise they are soft and cozy. I wear size 9 shoes and the size 8.5/9 fits me perfect.
customer_reviews.author: star9

customer_reviews.title: Too small to be comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because Isotoner products are usually really good. I was disappointed; however , because of the fit. I typically have an easy to fit foot, but these are way too short and very narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Donna S.

customer_reviews.title: They are well worth the cost & very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These Isotoner house slippers are true to size. I needed an adjustable type shoe with a thick cushioned sole. These were exactly as described. They are well worth the cost. I have had them for several months and they are very durable & comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: DHanzy

customer_reviews.title: Velcro overlap not long enough to fit over top of foot for closure.
customer_reviews.text: The length size is perfect for these really nice slippers. However, the closure barely fits over the top of my foot, so the velcro can not be closed. I gave them to my sister who wears the same size as I do, and her foot is even more narrow than mine - she had the same problem. Very unhappy that I cannot wear them.
customer_reviews.author: Over70

customer_reviews.title: Who's foot is this suppose to close on?
customer_reviews.text: I have a Cinderella foot. As an adult woman I'm still in kids sizes. I usually get a 4 1/2. The smallest in womens size I can fit is a 5. It fits in length but it wont velcro close and I have skinny foot. It will close on my 7 years old foot who wear a childs 12, but it wont close on my foot. Disappointed because I wasted money. It looks like it was gonna be so comfy. I need a comfy slide in because I'm to pregnant to bend forward to put on socks and shoes all the time
customer_reviews.author: StefanieR

customer_reviews.title: Made in China and not American sizes!!!!
customer_reviews.text: One problem—made in China and would fit a child’s foot not an adult 6 1/2. Tell your customers isotoner are Chinese products.
customer_reviews.author: PAULA C. BOTTOMLEY

customer_reviews.title: Great support. Comfortable. Until it fell apart.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in July. They were the most comfortable slippers I have ever owned. A couple of weeks ago, they literally fell apart! The bottom just separated into 2. My initial 5 stars is now 2 stars because of this. I am so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: isotoner
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted me to order two Pr. They arrived in great time and she said they fit perfectly. She takes a size 10. She said they are the best slippers she has every had and I have given her many types. We are in SO California and it never gets real cold here. She would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S.

customer_reviews.title: Love these slides!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love them...have had several pair...wear them all the time around the house...just the right thickness for walking comfort...Velcro adjustable...washes clean in washer...
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Collins

customer_reviews.title: Might be unsafe to wear
customer_reviews.text: Twice, within minutes after wearing these for the first time, I walked right out of the shoe! They do NOT stay fastened. I could easily have tripped and fallen. I actually did trip, but did not fall.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Scotty

customer_reviews.title: eventually I tamed it and it fits nicely now. Ta Tum
customer_reviews.text: Interesting "history". First couple of weeks, couldn't get the velcro-thingey to fit: first it was too tight, then too wide. I guess after wearing them and always manipulating changing the velcro, eventually I tamed it and it fits nicely now. Ta Tum!
customer_reviews.author: unsworthyeti

customer_reviews.title: Got These for Foot Surgery
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I'm having surgery on my foot. I'm taking these with me to the hospital so when I go home, I can put my foot in these without bumping my foot or causing discomfort. They are comfy and definitely adjustable & appear well-made. I can't speak to their longevity, but that isn't my primary focus. I need them to be easy to put on and not disturb/bother my foot.
customer_reviews.author: HighlandAngelTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I liked these except for a very uncomfortable design flaw. The velcro pokes through the material and rubs against my toes. VERY uncomfortable. I was very disappointed. I think I would have really liked them, except for this. They are being returned and I'll continue my search for some comfortable terrycloth slippers with memory foam insoles.
customer_reviews.author: ggolfer

customer_reviews.title: These are great! I've been through a lot of slippers and ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 7.5/8 I usually wear 6.5/7. These are great! I've been through a lot of slippers and I love these. I am 8 months pregnant, with painful feet. These help so much! Lots of padding. I've owned them for a few weeks now and the padding is still good, it hasn't flattened out. I'm planning on buying a pair for my mother because they are so comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Choco

customer_reviews.title: Great until you get them wet
customer_reviews.text: They are an adjustable fit over the top of your foot which is great but, the moment you get them wet them start to turn darker color for the foot pad. But, I bought extra 4 pairs because , I can never find any that Velcro over the foot to make a custom fit.
customer_reviews.author: Qof Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Life Changing
customer_reviews.text: These slippers are literally changed my life. I have plantar fasciitis and walking in the morning was virtually impossible. Now, I keep these slippers next to my bed and I put them on as soon as I get out of bed. I am walking with no pain again! Fit is great. The Velcro makes them snug enough.
customer_reviews.author: M. Semler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My mother had gout in her foot and couldn’t have any pressure on her foot without causing pain .these were perfect and so comfortable . You can adjust the tightness ... they have the best support
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: I love these slippers had a hard time finding them
customer_reviews.text: I love these slippers had a hard time finding them. They are so soft and I need to be able to adjust the opening because of foot surgery and I found these to be the best. Love the hard sole as I go outside with them on. Great product and will buy again and the shipping was fast.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely LOVE these!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE these!!! After working out for over 2 hours, I put these on after getting out of the shower, and my sore feet suddenly feel fantastic! Better than I had anticipated.... would HIGHLY recommend these to anyone who has sore feet at the end of the day or after a long workout session.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa Grizzard

customer_reviews.title: Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: These are super comfortable! The insole is quilted for super softness.The soles are thicker than I expected, but that just gives more cushioning. The velcro straps allow for a perfect fit. The rubber soles have a thin non-slip tread, but I have felt myself slip now and then so don't try running in these!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Rocks

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable with good arch support.
customer_reviews.text: While not the height of fashion, these are really comfortable and provide good support. I have very high arches and most running shoes don't even come close to the arch support of these slippers. One thing to note if you have narrow feet - due to the aforementioned high arch as well as a high instep, I rarely have a problem with shoes being too wide - usually quite the opposite. But these are a little loose around the sides of my foot. It would be good if they had more adjust-ability. But hey, I'm not jogging in them so I can live with it.
customer_reviews.author: sfwino

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable slippers I have ever owned!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best slippers I have ever owned. I had to size up because my size was too small. Exchange was very easy and one size up fit perfectly. Feels like you’re walking on air. Velcro makes it easy to tighten the fit. I’ve washed 2 times and they air dry quickly. This is the first time I’ve been able to wear slip on slippers and not had them come off while walking.
customer_reviews.author: Moll

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Not happy, been wearing these slippers for a few weeks, thought they were comfortable but I noticed today that they are beginning to filed apart. Not worth the price and poor workmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Fell Apart
customer_reviews.text: I have them a few months and wear them indoors only. I have not had to wash them yet and they are coming apart at the sole, very dispointed. I purchased two pair, I hope the other pair lasts. Update the same happened to the second pair, on both the soles separated from the rest of the slipper.
customer_reviews.author: redflower

customer_reviews.title: I bought these to walk on tile floors, as ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to walk on tile floors, as most slippers are just that.. slippery! I also didn't want something too hot as I live in Florida (though the tile floors still get cold!) . These work out really well. I do still have to walk with caution though, if you walk too fast they do not grip tile well.
customer_reviews.author: JenniferTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: House slippers
customer_reviews.text: My wife love these house slippers at first they where supportive, light weight and comfortable. But after wearing them for 69 days she ready to toss them in the trash. The padding is now flat she feels like she walking on cardboard !
customer_reviews.author: Baby boy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable slippers
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite slipper. They are comfortable, supportive, and they stay on. I like that they are adjustable with the velcro. I can wear them outdoors, to get the mail for example. The pink is a soft pink. Overall, I just like the fit of this slipper and can't wait to take off outdoor shoes and slip into these! 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara and Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great at begin but rapidly lost memory foam support
customer_reviews.text: At first they were great, really soft and easy to adjust to width of foot. After just a couple of weeks, the memory foam did not hold up and now they do not support the same way as on day one so can’t use them anymore...
customer_reviews.author: marion vancauwenbergh

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable bedroom slippers
customer_reviews.text: I love this slipper because of the Velcro closing. I have a slim foot and most slippers are too wide. I can adjust this one to fit, and it’s very comfortable, also. Wore one pair out and had to buy another!
customer_reviews.author: Lois J Greenwell

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Acorns for years, but their sizing changed. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the Isotonic not only fit well, but has a nice comfortable cushiony sole.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too WARM for summer!
customer_reviews.text: So, I'll wear these in cooler weather - with socks!
customer_reviews.author: sagetree

customer_reviews.title: The long search for the perfect slipper has ended!
customer_reviews.text: Superb comfort-sole very supportive and restorative for the feet-love the adjustable feature so you can custom fit each slipper and the gripper sole stabilizing. Put them on first thing when I walk in the door...and my feet than me.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Smith

customer_reviews.title: I like them but they have an order so don't put ...
customer_reviews.text: I like them but they have an order so don't put them in your closet until the smell leaves. They are very well cushioned but for some reason even though they are the correct size and fit correctly when I stand in them I feel some type of ridge at my toes and heels. The ridge doesn't bother too much but its there. Also the lining in slippery. They seem to be well made but I haven't worn them that much yet.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Me

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have had a black pair for some time now and this is my second pair. Perfect slipper for someone who needs the adjustability as I have narrow feet.
customer_reviews.author: rosesrpeachy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect slippers
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these slippers, I wear them everyday. They are very comfortable, sturdy and can be adjusted to my size. They have thicker soles that are very comfortable. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M.

customer_reviews.title: thought I could adjust the velcro
customer_reviews.text: had a similar pair I loved= these don;t fit as well= I have narrow width to be fair but the other isotoner model I had before this fit better- they looked similar but those were lighter terry and these are more furry. a little bulky for me/ I do like this brand better then dearfoams= last longer and quality is good
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Sinovoi

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for my sore feet
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair in 4 years. I have a lot of pain in my feet from Psoriasis of the bottom of my feet. I go through a lot of slippers because I wash them so much. Very comfortable doesn't loose it's cushion after extended wear. Washing Instructions Wash in cold water, short cycle if possible Dry on low heat. It's very important to dry them. I air dryer my first pair and they fell apart. They can endure multiple washings.
customer_reviews.author: CincyCheryl

customer_reviews.title: Hard to walk in. Not for people who have mobility issues.
customer_reviews.text: Too wobbly. Very squishy, hard to walk in. Widening the strap causes the scratchy side of the velcro to catch on things and scratch feet/legs.
customer_reviews.author: JBS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. Keeps my sore feet comfortable. Warm, but not too warm since my toes are exposed. Perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Shenanigan

customer_reviews.title: Comfort?
customer_reviews.text: Worst slippers I ever bought. Unconfortable, clunky, not bendable. Don't waste your money, giving these to Goodwill.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy'sPersuasiveJuggling

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I never thought that they would be this comfortable. At first I thought they were a tab short but my feet settled in perfectly. They are well worth the money... in fact they are VERY excellent for the price!! will buy them again next winter for sure. I wear them ALL the time and sometimes forget to take them off when I go out for a quick trip to the store, but they look so good!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Mason

product_meta.title: isotoner Women's Microterry Pillowstep Spa Slide
product_meta.description: Experience spa-like comfort in every step with isotoner's Microterry Spa Slide Slipper. Microterry uppers and lining, combined with a multilayer arch support PillowStep cushion insole, hugs your foot with an all around memory foam footbed. The slip-on, adjustable slide design and versatile indoor/outdoor soles keep your feet on the go from sofa to store to bedroom with comfortable confidence.
feature_bullets: Spa terry slide slipper in easy slip-on slide design with adjustable strap for indoor & outdoor wear
Plush terry house slipper keeps feet cozy and comfortable
Multilayer cushion insole hugs your foot with memory foam footbed for heel and arch support
Skid-resistant, weatherproof sole provides indoor & outdoor versatility
Lightweight slide slippers transition from house to spa to bedroom in timeless style. Care: Machine wash cool water; dry flat away from heat
